member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeBeaconWatcher.DoEddystoneTlmFrame(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.SByte,System.UInt32,System.UInt16,System.UInt32,System.Double,System.Byte[])
member.param: The Bluetooth LE advertiser's MAC address.
The frame's timestamp in Universal Time format.
The measured RSSI value in dBm at range between -100 dBm and +20 dBm at 1 dBm resolution.

The running count of advertisement frames of all types emitted by the beacon since power-up or reboot, useful for monitoring performance metrics that scale per broadcast frame. If this value is reset (e.g. on reboot), the current time field is also reset.
The current battery charge in millivolts, expressed as 1 mV per bit. If not supported (for example in a USB-powered beacon) the value should be zeroed.
The 0.1 second resolution counter that represents time since beacon power-up or reboot. If this value is reset (e.g. on a reboot), the AdvCnt count field is also reset.
The beacon temperature in degrees Celsius sensed by the beacon. If not supported the value is -128 C.
The additional frame data.

The Eddystone ID: 10 bytes - Namespace ID and 6 bytes - Instance ID.
The additional frame data.

member.name: T:wclBluetooth.wclGattClientConnection

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattClientConnection.PrepareForConnection
member.summary: The method called internally before connection.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: A derived class may override this method to process some connection pre-requirements that should be executed in the main thread UI. Used by BLED112 to be able to get protection parameters.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattClientConnection.MessageReceived(wclCommon.wclMessage)
member.summary: The method called when a new notification message received.
member.param: A object represents a notification message.

remarks.para: This method is for internal use only.
If a derived class overrides this method it must always call the inherited implementation first.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattClientConnection.HalConnect(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Implements a hardware-dependent code that connects to a remote device.
member.param: The system even object handle.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: Derived classes must override this method to implement a hardware-dependent code that connects to a remote device.
The method executes in a separate thread.

The method implementation must monitor the Event parameter. The Event parameter is set if the Disconnect method was called. If the termination event was set the method must terminate connection operation.
If connection to a remote device was terminated the method must release all allocated resources because the HalDisconnect will not be called.
A derived class must always call inherited method.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattClientConnection.HalDisconnect
member.summary: Implements a hardware-dependent code that disconnects from the connected remote device.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: The method is called only if a connection to a remote device was established with success (the Connect method was success).
The method will not be called if the connection to the remote device was terminated in the middle of the HalConnect method.
A derived class must always call inherited method.

member.param: A changed characteristic handle.
A characteristic value.
member.remarks: The Value parameter is valid only inside the event handler. If an application needs to use it outside the event handler it must be copied.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattClientConnection.Connect(System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.param: A remote device MAC address.

A Boolean indicates whether a connection should made during Connect call or on first services read. True indicates that the connection should be executed on first services read on when OS decided to do that.

A Boolean indicates that the notifications (and/or indications) should be forced. This should be set to True for some boards (such as Bluno, Bluno Mega and some others) that do not have Characteristic Client Configuration Descriptor.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: The method starts a connection operation to a remote device. If the method success that does not mean that the connection was established. That just means that the connection operation was started. The real connection result will be passed to the OnConnect event handler.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattClientConnection.GetConnectionParams(wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParameters@)
member.param: If the function completed with success on output contains the current connection parameters.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: This feature is supported with BLED112 dongle and with Microsoft Bluetooth drivers on Windows 11 and above.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattClientConnection.SetConnectionParams(wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParametersType)
member.summary: Request the connection parameters change to the specified preferred connection parameters.
member.param: The preferred Bluetooth LE connection parameters type.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: When performing firmware updates, higher throughput is necessary to complete the operation swiftly for the user. In those scenarios, you should request ppThroughputOptimized connection parameters for the duration of the firmware update. That will reduce the number of concurrent connections to other Bluetooth peripherals, and should be used sparingly.

Conversely, when connecting to multiple LE devices concurrently, you should use ppPowerOptimized. That will increase the acceptable peripheral latency for the connection, reducing the interval at which the LE device must respond to the host OS. That allows the local Bluetooth radio to schedule more connections concurrently, and reduces power usage on both the host OS and on the peripheral device.
If the connection parameters were changed successfully the OnConnectionParamsChanged even fires.
This feature is supported with BLED112 dongle and with Microsoft Bluetooth drivers on Windows 11 and above.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattClientConnection.SetConnectionParams(wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParametersValue)
member.summary: Request the connection parameters change to the specified preferred connection parameters.
member.param: The preferred Bluetooth LE connection parameters value.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: If the connection parameters were changed successfully the OnConnectionParamsChanged even fires.
This feature is supported with BLED112 dongle and with Microsoft Bluetooth drivers on Windows 11 and above.

member.summary: Reads the maximum PDU size for the current connection.
member.param: If the method completed with success on output contains the maximum PDU size.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: The PDU size includes header and payload. For example if PDU size is 23 bytes the allowed payload is 20 bytes.

member.name: P:wclBluetooth.wclGattClientConnection.ConnectOnRead
member.value: The Boolean indicates the connection mode.

member.name: P:wclBluetooth.wclGattClientConnection.ForceNotifications
member.value: The Boolean indicates the notifications mode.
member.remarks: If this property set to True the characteristic value changes notification (and/or indication) will work correctly with some boards (such as Bluno, Bluno Meag and some others) that do not have Characteristic Client Configucation Descriptor.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclRfCommClientConnection.Connect(System.Int64,System.Guid,System.Byte,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.UInt32)
member.param: The remote Bluetooth device address.

The Bluetooth Service UUID. If the Channel parameter is zero, the system attempts to use Service to resolve the remote channel corresponding to the service. The service class is a normalized 128-bit GUID, defined by the Bluetooth specification. Common GUIDs are defined by the Bluetooth Assigned Numbers document. Alternatively, a unique GUID may be used for a domain-specific application.
The RFCOMM channel number. If zero the Service UUID will be used.

Specifies that authentication is required for a connect operation to complete successfully. Setting this option actively initiates authentication during connection establishment, if the two Bluetooth devices were not previously authenticated.
The option enforces encryption to establish a connection. Encryption is only available for authenticated connections.
The connect timeout in milliseconds. The default value is 10000 milliseconds.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: The method starts a connection operation to a remote device. If the method success that does not mean that the connection was established. That just means that the connection operation was started. The real connection result will be passed to the OnConnect event handler.
NOTE: BlueSoleil does not support Authentication and Encryption parameters per connection.

member.summary: Gets the encryption state of the connection.
member.value: True if the connection is encrypted. False otherwise.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclRfCommServerConnection.DoGetSdpAttributes(System.UInt16[]@,wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothSdpProfile[]@,System.Byte[]@,System.UInt32@)
member.param: The additional protocol descriptors array that should be added to SDP record.
The profile list that should be added to SDP record.
Other attributes that should be added to SDP record.

param.name: Cod
param.para: Class of device (COD) information. A 32-bit parameter of COD_SERVICE_* class of device bits associated with this SDP record. The system combines these bits with COD bits from other service records and system characteristics. The resulting class of device for the local radio is advertised when the radio is found during device inquiry. When the last SDP record associated with a particular service bit is deleted, that service bit is no longer reported in responses to future device inquiries.

The format and possible values for the COD field are defined in the Bluetooth Assigned Numbers 1.1 portion of the Bluetooth specification, Section 1.2. (This resource may not be available in some languages and countries.)

remarks.para: The HAL Radio implementation calls this method when needs to add custom attributes into the SDP record.
BlueSoleil driver does not support custom SDP records and this method does not work with BlueSoleil Bluetooth driver.
A derived class must always call the inherited method.

member.summary: The method starts listening for client connections.
member.param: The Bluetooth Service UUID. If the Channel parameter is zero, the system attempts to use Service to resolve the remote channel corresponding to the service. The service class is a normalized 128-bit GUID, defined by the Bluetooth specification. Common GUIDs are defined by the Bluetooth Assigned Numbers document. Alternatively, a unique GUID may be used for a domain-specific application.
The option service name.
The RFCOMM channel number. If zero the Service UUID will be used.

Specifies that authentication is required for a connect operation to complete successfully. Setting this option actively initiates authentication during connection establishment, if the two Bluetooth devices were not previously authenticated.
The option enforces encryption to establish a connection. Encryption is only available for authenticated connections.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: NOTE: BlueSoleil has limited support for Authentication and Encryption.. Also it doe snot support user-defined RFCOMM channel number.

An application must never create instances of this class directly. Instead of that an application must use related methods from the object.
The feature is supported only on Windows 10 platform with Microsoft Bluetooth drivers.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclWiiRemoteClientConnection.ProcessReport(System.Byte[])
member.summary: The function parses the received report.
member.param: A pointer to the report data.
member.remarks: The method must be called from the communication thread to process received reports.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclWiiRemoteClientConnection.MessageReceived(wclCommon.wclMessage)
member.summary: The method called when a new notification message received.
member.param: A object represents a notification message.

remarks.para: This method is for internal use only.
If a derived class overrides this method it must always call the inherited implementation first.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclWiiRemoteClientConnection.HalConnect(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Implements a hardware-dependent code that connects to a remote device.
member.param: The system even object handle.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: Derived classes must override this method to implement a hardware-dependent code that connects to a remote device.
The method executes in a separate thread.

The method implementation must monitor the Event parameter. The Event parameter is set if the Disconnect method was called. If the termination event was set the method must terminate connection operation.
If connection to a remote device was terminated the method must release all allocated resources because the HalDisconnect will not be called.
A derived class must always call inherited method.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclWiiRemoteClientConnection.HalDisconnect
member.summary: Implements a hardware-dependent code that disconnects from the connected remote device.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: The method is called only if a connection to a remote device was established with success (the Connect method was success).
The method will not be called if the connection to the remote device was terminated in the middle of the HalConnect method.

A derived HalConnect implementation must always call the HalConnect method first, before any other connection operation. If the connection is failed the derived implementation must always call inherited HalDisconnect method.
A derived class must always call inherited method.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclWiiRemoteClientConnection.HalWrite(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Implements a hardware-dependent code that writes data report to the connected Wii Remote controller.
member.param: The pointer to the report data buffer.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: A derived class must override this method to implement a hardware-dependent code that sends data to the connected device. The method executes in the main thread and must be synchronous.
A derived implementation must always call this method in case of the derived HalConnect failed.

member.name: T:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothGetSdpAttributesEvent
member.param: The object initiates the event.
The additional protocol descriptors array that should be added to SDP record.
The profile descriptors list that should be added to SDP record.
Other attributes that should be added to SDP record.

param.name: Cod
param.para: Class of device (COD) information. A 32-bit parameter of COD_SERVICE_* class of device bits associated with this SDP record. The system combines these bits with COD bits from other service records and system characteristics. The resulting class of device for the local radio is advertised when the radio is found during device inquiry. When the last SDP record associated with a particular service bit is deleted, that service bit is no longer reported in responses to future device inquiries.

The format and possible values for the COD field are defined in the Bluetooth Assigned Numbers 1.1 portion of the Bluetooth specification, Section 1.2. (This resource may not be available in some languages and countries.)

The running count of advertisement frames of all types emitted by the beacon since power-up or reboot, useful for monitoring performance metrics that scale per broadcast frame. If this value is reset (e.g. on reboot), the current time field is also reset.
The current battery charge in millivolts, expressed as 1 mV per bit. If not supported (for example in a USB-powered beacon) the value should be zeroed.
The 0.1 second resolution counter that represents time since beacon power-up or reboot. If this value is reset (e.g. on a reboot), the AdvCnt count field is also reset.
The beacon temperature in degrees Celsius sensed by the beacon. If not supported the value is -128 C.

member.name: T:wclBluetooth.wclBleSnifferAdvDirectIndReceivedEvent
member.summary: The BLE sniffer OnAdvDirectIndReceived event handler prototype.
member.param: The object initiates the event.
The PDU header.
The advertiser address.
The address of the device to which this PDU is addressed.
member.remarks: The TxAdd field of the PduHeader parameter indicates whether the advertisers address in the AdvA parameter is public (TxAdd = False) or random (TxAdd = True). The RxAdd field of the PduHeader parameter indicates whether the targets address in the TargetA parameter is public (RxAdd = False) or random (RxAdd = True). The ChSel field in the PduHeader parameter is True if the advertiser supports the LE Channel Selection Algorithm #2 feature.

member.name: T:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeAdvertisementType
member.summary: Types of the Bluetooth LE advertisement packet.

summary.para: The advertisement is undirected and indicates that the device is connectable and scannable. This advertisement type can carry data.
This corresponds with the ADV_IND type defined in the Bluetooth LE specifications.
The advertisement is directed and indicates that the device is connectable but not scannable. This advertisement type cannot carry data.
This corresponds with the ADV_DIRECT_IND type defined in the Bluetooth LE specifications.
The advertisement is undirected and indicates that the device is scannable but not connectable. This advertisement type can carry data.
This corresponds with the ADV_SCAN_IND type defined in the Bluetooth LE specifications.
The advertisement is undirected and indicates that the device is not connectable nor scannable. This advertisement type can carry data.
This corresponds with the ADV_NONCONN_IND type defined in the Bluetooth LE specifications.
This advertisement is a scan response to a scan request issued for a scannable advertisement. This advertisement type can carry data.
This corresponds with the SCAN_RSP type defined in the Bluetooth LE specifications.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeAdvertisementType.atExtended
member.summary: This advertisement is a 5.0 extended advertisement. This advertisement type may have different properties, and is not necessarily directed, connected, scannable, nor a scan response.

member.summary: Simultaneous Bluetooth LE and BR/EDR to same device capable (host).

member.name: T:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParametersType
member.summary: The enumeration defines the Bluetooth LE GATT preferred connection parameters.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParametersType.ppBalanced
member.summary: The balanced set of connection parameters, offering a balance between throughput and power usage.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParametersType.ppPowerOptimized
member.summary: The more power-efficient set of connection parameters. Optimized for power usage at the expense of throughput. Also allows for more simultaneous connections to other Bluetooth devices.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParametersType.ppThroughputOptimized
member.summary: The more aggressive set of connection parameters, optimized for faster throughput at the expense of power usage. Also reduces the number of simultaneous connections that can be made to other Bluetooth devices.

summary.para: Error other than time-out at L2CAP or Bluetooth radio level.

Usually this error appears if you try to connect to device that is paired on PC side but PC is not paired or has been unpaired on the device side. Unpairing device on PC side usually solves the error.

member.name: T:wclBluetooth.wclGattClient
member.remarks: The TwclGattClient component enables an application to connect to a Bluetooth Low Energy device and work with GATT profiles.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattClient.DoCharacteristicChanged(System.UInt16,System.Byte[])
member.param: A changed characteristic handle.
A characteristic value.
member.remarks: The Value parameter is valid only inside the event handler. If an application needs to use it outside the event handler it must be copied.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattClient.DoConnect(System.Int32)
member.param: The operation result.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattClient.Connect(wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothRadio)
member.summary: Connects to a remote Bluetooth LE device.
member.param: The object used to communicate with a remote Bluetooth device.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: The method starts connection to a remote Bluetooth LE device. When connection operation completed the OnConnected event will fire. The operation result will be passed into the OnConnected event.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattClient.Disconnect
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

member.summary: The method searches the characteristic in given service with the specified UUID.
member.param: The GATT services.
The required characteristic's UUID.
If the method completed with success on output contains the required characteristic. If the method failed the value is undefined.
Operation behavior flag.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

Operation behavior flag.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

member.summary: The method reads all the characteristics available for the specified service.
member.param: Parent service returned by the call to the ReadServices method.
Operation behavior flag.
On output a list of the service's characteristics. An application is responsible to clean up a memory allocated for the dynamic array.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattClient.ReadCharacteristicValue(wclBluetooth.wclGattCharacteristic,wclBluetooth.wclGattOperationFlag,System.Byte[]@,wclBluetooth.wclGattProtectionLevel)
member.summary: The method reads the value of the specified characteristic.
member.param: A structure obtained by previous call to the ReadCaracteristics method.
Operation behavior flag.
On output contains a characteristic's value as bytes array. An application is responsible to clean up a memory allocated for the dynamic array.
Describes the required protection level.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

member.param: If the function completed with success on output contains the current connection parameters.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattClient.SetConnectionParams(wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParametersType)
member.summary: Request the connection parameters change to the specified preferred connection parameters.
member.param: The preferred Bluetooth LE connection parameters type.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: When performing firmware updates, higher throughput is necessary to complete the operation swiftly for the user. In those scenarios, you should request ppThroughputOptimized connection parameters for the duration of the firmware update. That will reduce the number of concurrent connections to other Bluetooth peripherals, and should be used sparingly.

Conversely, when connecting to multiple LE devices concurrently, you should use ppPowerOptimized. That will increase the acceptable peripheral latency for the connection, reducing the interval at which the LE device must respond to the host OS. That allows the local Bluetooth radio to schedule more connections concurrently, and reduces power usage on both the host OS and on the peripheral device.
If the connection parameters were changed successfully the OnConnectionParamsChanged even fires.
This feature is supported with BLED112 dongle and with Microsoft Bluetooth drivers on Windows 11 and above.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattClient.SetConnectionParams(wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParametersValue)
member.summary: Request the connection parameters change to the specified preferred connection parameters.
member.param: The preferred Bluetooth LE connection parameters value.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: If the connection parameters were changed successfully the OnConnectionParamsChanged even fires.
This feature is supported with BLED112 dongle and with Microsoft Bluetooth drivers on Windows 11 and above.

member.remarks: The PDU size includes header and payload. For example if PDU size is 23 bytes the allowed payload is 20 bytes.

members.member: Gets and sets connection mode. The Boolean indicates the connection mode. If this property set to True the connection to a target device will be executed on first services read or when the OS decided to do that. If the property is False the connection will be executed (if possible) on Connect call. ///

member.value: The Boolean indicates the notifications mode.
member.remarks: If this property set to True the characteristic value changes notification (and/or indication) will work correctly with some boards (such as Bluno, Bluno Meag and some others) that do not have Characteristic Client Configucation Descriptor.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattServerClient.SetConnectionParams(wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParametersType)
member.summary: Request the connection parameters change to the specified preferred connection parameters.
member.param: The preferred Bluetooth LE connection parameters type.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: When performing firmware updates, higher throughput is necessary to complete the operation swiftly for the user. In those scenarios, you should request ppThroughputOptimized connection parameters for the duration of the firmware update. That will reduce the number of concurrent connections to other Bluetooth peripherals, and should be used sparingly.

Conversely, when connecting to multiple LE devices concurrently, you should use ppPowerOptimized. That will increase the acceptable peripheral latency for the connection, reducing the interval at which the LE device must respond to the host OS. That allows the local Bluetooth radio to schedule more connections concurrently, and reduces power usage on both the host OS and on the peripheral device.
If the connection parameters were changed successfully the OnConnectionParamsChanged even fires.
This feature is supported with Microsoft Bluetooth drivers on Windows 11 and above.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclGattServerClient.SetConnectionParams(wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParametersValue)
member.summary: Request the connection parameters change to the specified preferred connection parameters.
member.param: The preferred Bluetooth LE connection parameters value.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: If the connection parameters were changed successfully the OnConnectionParamsChanged even fires.
This feature is supported with Microsoft Bluetooth drivers on Windows 11 and above.

member.summary: Responds to the request with an error.
member.param: The GATT operation error code.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: A derived class must override this method to provide hardware dependent code that sends a error respond.
An application must call this method in case if there is an error appeared during request processing. The Error is one of the Wireless Communication Library GATT error.
The result indicates that the error code passed to the method is not one from the GATT errors list.
Valid error codes are:

member.value: True if the Bluetooth LE advertising is running.

member.value: The number of the Bluetooth LE advertisements.

member.name: P:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeAdvertiser.Interval
member.summary: Gets and sets the advertising interval.
member.value: The advertising interval in 0.625ms units. The value must be in range between 32 and 16384.

member.name: P:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeAdvertiser.Anonymous
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the device address is included in the advertisement header. By default, the address is included.
member.value: Indicates whether the device address is hidden. The default value is False, indicating that the address is included.

remarks.para: The Extended Advertising format must be enabled by setting the UseExtendedAdvertisement to True to use this property. If the UseExtendedAdvertisement is False the value of this property is ignored.
If the advertiser is running and an application changes the property the exception raises.

member.name: P:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeAdvertiser.IncludeTxRssi
member.summary: Specifies whether the transmit power level is included in the advertisement header.
member.value: Indicates whether the transmit power level is included. The default value is False.

remarks.para: The Extended Advertising format must be enabled by setting the UseExtendedAdvertisement to True to use this property. If the UseExtendedAdvertisement is False the value of this property is ignored.
If the advertiser is running and an application changes the property the exception raises.

member.name: P:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeAdvertiser.PreferredTxRssi
member.summary: If specified, requests that the radio use the indicated transmit power level for the advertisement.
member.value: The requested power level in dDm at range between -100 dBm and +20 for the radio transmission. The default is -127 indicating that this feature is disabled. If the parameter is out of range the exception raises.

remarks.para: Enabling the Extended Advertising format is necessary to enable several other related properties.
If the advertiser is running and an application changes the property the exception raises.

member.name: P:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeAdvertiser.UseExtendedAdvertisement
member.summary: Specifies that the advertisement publisher should use the Extended Advertising format.
member.value: Indicates whether or not the Extended Advertising format should be used. The default value is False.

remarks.para: Enabling the Extended Advertising format is necessary to enable several other related properties.
If the advertiser is running and an application changes the property the exception raises.

member.summary: The Bluetooth LE custom raw advertisement.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeRawAdvertisement.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates new Bluetooth LE advertisement object.
member.param: The Bluetooth LE advertisement raw data.

remarks.para: The following advertisement data types are reserved and are not allowed:
* Empty flags (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_NONE [0x00])
* Flags (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_FLAGS [0x01])
* Shortened Local Name (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_LOCAL_NAME_SHORT [0x08])
* Complete Local Name (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_LOCAL_NAME_COMPLETE [0x09])
* LE Bluetooth Device Address (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_ADDRESS [0x1B])
* LE Role (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_ROLE [0x1C])
* Incomplete List of 16-bit Service UUIDs (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_SERVICES_16_MORE [0x02])
* Complete List of 16-bit Service Class UUIDs * (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_SERVICES_16_ALL [0x03])
* Incomplete List of 32-bit Service UUIDs (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_SERVICES_32_MORE [0x04])
* Complete List of 32-bit Service Class UUIDs (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_SERVICES_32_ALL [0x05])
* Incomplete List of 128-bit Service UUIDs (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_SERVICES_128_MORE [0x06])
* Complete List of 128-bit Service Class UUIDs (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_SERVICES_128_ALL [0x07])
* Tx Power Level (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_TXPOWER [0x0A])
* Class of Device (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_COD [0x0D])
* Simple Pairing Hash C192 (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_PAIRING_HASH_C [0x0E])
* Simple Pairing Randomizer R192 (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_PAIRING_RAND_R [0x0F])
* Security Manager TK Values (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_DEVICE_ID [0x10])
* Security Manager Out-of-Band Flags (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_SM_OOB_FLAGS [0x11])
* Slave Connection Interval Range (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_CON_INTERVALS [0x12])
* Public Target Address (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_PUBLIC_TARGET_ADDRESS [0x17])
* Random Target Address (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_RANDOM_TARGET_ADDRESS [0x18])
* Appearance (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_APPEARANCE [0x19])
* Advertising Interval (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_ADV_INTERVAL [0x1A])
* Simple Pairing Hash C256 (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_PAIRING_HASH_C_256 [0x1D])
* Simple Pairing Randomizer R256 (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_PAIRING_RAND_R_256 [0x1E])
* 3D Information Data (LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_3D_INFO [0x3D])

remarks.para: The TwclBluetoothManager is the main component of the Bluetooth Framework. Each application that uses the Bluetooth Framework must have one and only one active instance of the Bluetooth Manager.
This component must be created and opened in an application's main thread only.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothManager.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new Bluetooth Manager component.
member.remarks: The component must always be created in an application's main thread.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothManager.Close
member.summary: Closes the Bluetooth Manager and releases all allocated resources.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: After calling this method an application should not use any of the Bluetooth Framework features. All instances of the class are not valid after calling this method.
An application must call this method from its main thread only.

The call to this method may take some time because it requires to release all allocated resources and terminate all the running threads. The common case when the delay may appear is when your application started discovering for remote devices and right after that the Close was called. In this case Bluetooth Manager has to wait for discovering thread completion.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothManager.Open(wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothApi,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Opens the Bluetooth Manager and allocated required hardware resources.
member.param: The set of APIs the should be used by Bluetooth Framework.
Allows to disable pairing handling by Bluetooth Framework. Set this to false to disable Bluetooth Framework pairing. Set to true (the default value) to enable Bluetooth Framework pairing.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: An application must call this method before using any of the Bluetooth Framework features.
An application must call this method from its main thread only.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothRadio.SetConnectable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Changes the connectable state of the local Bluetooth Radio.
member.param: The new connectable state for the Radio.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: Setting the Conenctable parameter to True allows remote Bluetooth enabled devices to connect to this Radio.
Setting the Conenctable parameter to False blocks the Radio from remote Bluetooth enabled devices connecting.

Microsoft: A radio that is non-connectable is non-discoverable. The radio must be made non-discoverable prior to making a radio non-connectable. Failure to make a radio non-discoverable prior to making it non-connectable will result in failure of this method call.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothRadio.SetDiscoverable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Changes the discoverable state of the local Bluetooth Radio.
member.param: The new discoverable state for the Radio.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: Setting the Discoverable parameter to True allows remote Bluetooth enabled devices to discover this Radio.
Setting the Discoverable parameter to False blocks the Radio from discovering by remote Bluetooth enabled devices.

Microsoft: Use the GetDiscoverable method to determine the current state of a Bluetooth radio. Windows ensures that a discoverable system is connectable, and as such, the radio must allow incoming connections prior to making a radio discoverable. Failure to allow incoming connections results in the SetDiscoverable method call failing.

When SetDiscoverable changes the discovery state, the new state is valid for the lifetime of the calling application. Additionally, if a Bluetooth radio previously made discoverable with this function is disabled and re-enabled via the application, discoverability will not persist. Once the calling application terminates, the discovery state of the specified Bluetooth radio reverts to the state it was in before SetDiscoverable was called.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothRadio.SetName(System.String)
member.summary: Sets a new name for the local Bluetooth Radio module.
member.param: The new Radio name.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothRadio.TurnOn
member.summary: The method turns the local Bluetooth radio ON.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothRadio.TurnOff
member.summary: The method turns the local Bluetooth radio OFF.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

members.member:
Starts discovering for a remote Bluetooth enabled devices. Specifies the maximum amount of time before the inquiry is halted (in seconds). Specifies the discovered Bluetooth device types. /// Set this parameter to true if you need to get paired devices reported as just found even such devices are not available. If this parameter is false only available devices will be returned. If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.
If the discovering started the OnDiscoveringStarted event of the component fires.
When the discovering for the remote Bluetooth enabled devices completed (with or without success) the OnDiscoveringCompleted event of the component fires.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothRadio.Terminate
member.summary: Terminates the discovering of remote Bluetooth enabled devices.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: On legacy Windows (Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8 and 8.1) platforms with Microsoft Bluetooth drivers the Terminate method does not terminate discovering but simple indicates that the discovering result should be ignored and keeps discovering thread runs in background. If you call the Close method right after Terminate call and the discovering has not been completed yet you may get delay with the Close method return because it has to wait for the discovering thread completion.

member.remarks: This function supports Classic Bluetooth devices only.

members.member: Enumerates already installed Bluetooth virtual COM ports. If the function completed with success contains array of all installed Bluetooth virtual COM ports. If not one vCOM was found the value of the ComPorts parameter can be null. If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes. The function enumerates all installed Bluetooth virtual COM ports. The list includes vCOMs created by the application and vCOMs created by an user outside the application. ///

member.name: P:wclBluetooth.wclRfCommClient.Authentication
member.summary: Gets and sets the authentication property for the connection.
member.value: True if the authentication is enabled.

remarks.para: If an application changes the property when connection is active the exception raises.
If the Authentication if switched off (False) the Encryption is also switched off.

member.name: P:wclBluetooth.wclRfCommClient.Channel
member.summary: Gets and sets the RFCOMM channel number used for connection.
member.value: The RF COMM channel number. The value must be between 0 and 33 (including 0 and 32).

remarks.para: If an application changes the property when connection is active the exception raises.

If the Channel value is 0 a Bluetooth driver try to resolve required channel number by querying a target devices SDP using the service's UUID. In this case it will use the first found service that matches the UUID.

member.name: P:wclBluetooth.wclRfCommClient.Encryption
member.summary: Gets and sets the Encryption property for the connection.
member.value: True if Encryption is enabled for the connection.

remarks.para: If an application changes the property when connection is active the exception raises.
The Encryption can be set to True only if the Authentication property is also set to True.

member.name: P:wclBluetooth.wclRfCommClient.Timeout
member.summary: Gets and sets the connect timeout value.
member.value: The connect timeout value in milliseconds.
member.remarks: If an application changes the property when client is connected the exception raises. If new value of the Timeout is 0 the exception raises.

member.summary: The event fires when connection to a remote device has been established with success to allow application provide a data processor for the connection.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclRfCommServer.DoGetSdpAttributes(System.UInt16[]@,wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothSdpProfile[]@,System.Byte[]@,System.UInt32@)
member.param: The additional protocol descriptors array that should be added to SDP record.
The profile list that should be added to SDP record.
Other attributes that should be added to SDP record.

param.name: Cod
param.para: Class of device (COD) information. A 32-bit parameter of COD_SERVICE_* class of device bits associated with this SDP record. The system combines these bits with COD bits from other service records and system characteristics. The resulting class of device for the local radio is advertised when the radio is found during device inquiry. When the last SDP record associated with a particular service bit is deleted, that service bit is no longer reported in responses to future device inquiries.

The format and possible values for the COD field are defined in the Bluetooth Assigned Numbers 1.1 portion of the Bluetooth specification, Section 1.2. (This resource may not be available in some languages and countries.)

remarks.para: The HAL Radio implementation calls this method when needs to add custom attributes into the SDP record.
BlueSoleil driver does not support custom SDP records and this method does not work with BlueSoleil Bluetooth driver.
A derived class must always call the inherited method.

member.name: M:wclBluetooth.wclBleSniffer.DoAdvDirectIndReceived(wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeAdvertisingPduHeader,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.param: The PDU header.
The advertiser address.
The address of the device to which this PDU is addressed.
member.remarks: The TxAdd field of the PduHeader parameter indicates whether the advertisers address in the AdvA parameter is public (TxAdd = False) or random (TxAdd = True). The RxAdd field of the PduHeader parameter indicates whether the targets address in the TargetA parameter is public (RxAdd = False) or random (RxAdd = True). The ChSel field in the PduHeader parameter is True if the advertiser supports the LE Channel Selection Algorithm #2 feature.

member.remarks: The TxAdd field of the PduHeader parameter indicates whether the advertisers address in the AdvA parameter is public (TxAdd = False) or random (TxAdd = True). The ChSel field in the PduHeader parameter is True if the advertiser supports the LE Channel Selection Algorithm #2 feature.

member.summary: Indicates if the Low Energy (LE) UUID a 16-bit shortened value, or if it is the long 128-bit value.

member.summary: The short 16-bit value of the UUID. This member applies only if IsShortUuid is True.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclGattUuid.LongUuid
member.summary: The long 128-bit value of the UUID. This member applies only if IsShortUuid is False.

member.summary: The characteristic can be signed writable.

member.name: T:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeAdvertisementFrame
member.summary: The structure represents a single Bluetooth LE advertisement data section.
member.remarks: This structure is used internally by the Bluetooth LE advertiser.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeAdvertisementFrame.CompanyId
member.summary: The manufacturer ID as defined in the Bluetooth SIG Assigned Numbers.
member.remarks: This member is valid only when the advertisement data type is LE_GAP_AD_TYPE_MANUFACTURER.

member.name: T:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParameters
member.summary: The structure describes the current Bluetooth LE GATT connection parameters.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParameters.Interval
member.remarks: The connection interval is defined as 1.25ms increments, ranging from 6 to 3200. Time(ms) = Interval * 1.25ms.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParameters.Latency
member.remarks: The connection latency is defined in connection events, ranging from 0 to 499.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParameters.LinkTimeout
member.remarks: The connection link supervision timeout is defined in 10ms increments, ranging from 10 to 3200. Time(ms) = LinkTimeout * 10ms.

member.name: T:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParametersValue
member.summary: The structure represents the Bluetooth LE GATT preferred connection parameters.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParametersValue.MinInterval
member.remarks: The connection interval is defined as 1.25ms increments, ranging from 6 to 3200. Time(ms) = Interval * 1.25ms.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParametersValue.MaxInterval
member.remarks: The connection interval is defined as 1.25ms increments, ranging from 6 to 3200. Time(ms) = Interval * 1.25ms.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParametersValue.Latency
member.remarks: The connection latency is defined in connection events, ranging from 0 to 499.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeConnectionParametersValue.LinkTimeout
member.remarks: The connection link supervision timeout is defined in 10ms increments, ranging from 10 to 3200. Time(ms) = LinkTimeout * 10ms.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLePacketHeader.Crc
member.summary: The CRC value. The CRC is 3 bytes long so hight byte is always 0x00.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLePacketHeader.Valid
member.summary: The packed valid status (True if the packet is valid. False otherwise.

member.name: T:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeAdvertisingPduHeader
member.summary: The record describes the Bluetooth LE advertising packet PDU header.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeAdvertisingPduHeader.Header
member.summary: The Bluetooth LE captured packet header.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeAdvertisingPduHeader.PduType
member.summary: The Bluetooth LE advertising PDU type.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeAdvertisingPduHeader.ChSel
member.remarks: The meaning of this field (bit) depends on the PDU type. If the value of this field is True the ChSel bit is 1. If the value of this field is Flase the ChSel bit is 0.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeAdvertisingPduHeader.TxAdd
member.remarks: The meaning of this field (bit) depends on the PDU type. If the value of this field is True the TxAdd bit is 1. If the value of this field is Flase the TxAdd bit is 0.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothLeAdvertisingPduHeader.RxAdd
member.remarks: The meaning of this field (bit) depends on the PDU type. If the value of this field is True the RxAdd bit is 1. If the value of this field is Flase the RxAdd bit is 0.

member.name: T:wclBluetooth.wclBleSnifferLlData
member.summary: The record contains the Link Layer data captured by the Bluetooth LE sniffer and used in the CONNECT_IND advertisement packet.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBleSnifferLlData.Aa
member.summary: The field contains the ACL connections Access Address determined by the Link Layer.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBleSnifferLlData.CrcInit
member.summary: The field contains the initialization value for the CRC calculation for the ACL connection. It shall be a random value, generated by the Link Layer. The seed for the random number generator is from a physical source of entropy and has at least 20 bits of entropy.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBleSnifferLlData.WinSize
member.summary: The field indicates the transmit window size value in the following manner: WindowSize = WinSize * 1.25ms.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBleSnifferLlData.WinOffset
member.summary: The field indicates the transmit window offset value in the following manner: WindowOffset = WinOffset * 1.25ms.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBleSnifferLlData.Interval
member.summary: The field indicates the connection interval in the following manner: ConnectionInterval = Interval * 1.25ms.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBleSnifferLlData.Latency
member.summary: The field indicates the peripheral latency value.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBleSnifferLlData.Timeout
member.summary: The field indicates the connection supervision timeout value in the following manner: SupervisionTimeout = Timeout * 10ms.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBleSnifferLlData.ChM
member.summary: The field contains the channel map indicating Used and Unused data channels. Every channel is represented with a bit positioned as per the data channel index. The LSB represents data channel index 0 and the bit in position 36 represents data channel index 36. A bit value of 0 indicates that the channel is Unused. A bit value of 1 indicates that the channel is Used. The bits in positions 37, 38 and 39 are reserved for future use.
member.remarks: The ChM value is 5 bytes long. The high 3 bytes are not used.

member.name: F:wclBluetooth.wclBleSnifferLlData.Hop
member.summary: The field indicates the hop increment used in the data channel selection algorithm. It has a random value in the range 5 to 16.

summary.p: The field indicates the central SCA used to determine the Central's worst case sleep clock accuracy. The value of the SCA are:

member.name: T:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothOobData
member.summary: The structure contains data used to authenticate prior to establishing an Out-of-Band device pairing.

member.name: P:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothOobData.C
member.summary: Gets and sets a 128-bit cryptographic key used for two-way authentication.
member.value: A 128-bit cryptographic key used for two-way authentication.

member.name: P:wclBluetooth.wclBluetoothOobData.R
member.summary: Gets and sets a randomly generated number used for one-way authentication.
member.value: A randomly generated number used for one-way authentication. If this number is not provided by the device initiating the OOB session, this value is 0.
